Title: Mid-level Data Scientist | GenAI
Description:
Apply now for a career that puts wellbeing first!

GET TO KNOW US

Wellhub (formerly Gympass*) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company.


Big news: Gympass is now Wellhub! We are thrilled to announce our rebranding as Wellhub, marking a significant milestone in our journey. This transformation reflects our evolution from a "pass for gyms" to a comprehensive employee wellbeing solution. With our refreshed identity, we are poised to embark on an exciting new chapter of growth and expansion. We are elevating our offerings, including a completely new app experience and an expanded network of wellbeing partners. Learn more about it here.


THE OPPORTUNITY

We are hiring a Mid-level Data Scientist for our GenAI team in Portugal!

Our GenAI team leverages advanced AI technologies to personalize user experiences, streamline operations, and optimize resources, acting as a hub for innovation while enabling Wellhub to harness the full potential of generative AI across multiple domains.

We are looking for a talented and motivated Data Scientist to join us and contribute to groundbreaking projects in the field of Generative AI.

YOUR IMPACT

As a Data Scientist specializing in Generative AI, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and deploying AI models that can generate content, solutions, and insights across various domains. You will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of engineers, and domain experts to create innovative AI applications that solve real-world problems.


Model Development: Design, implement, and optimize generative models using advanced machine learning and deep learning techniques, including GANs, VAEs, autoregressive models, and transformers;
Model Fine tuning: Fine-tune pre-trained models to adapt to specific use cases and requirements, including performing large language models (LLMs) fine-tuning and optimization for enhanced model performance. Additionally, collaborate with data scientists to annotate and preprocess data for model training, ensuring the models are tailored effectively to the intended applications.
Prompt Engineering: Develop and refine prompts to enhance the performance and output quality of generative models, ensuring that the models respond accurately and relevantly to various input scenarios.
Data Preparation: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to ensure high-quality input data for training generative models.
Embeddings: Develop and utilize embeddings to represent complex data types (e.g., text, images) in a way that facilitates the generation of meaningful and accurate outputs.
Research and Innovation: Stay current with the latest research in generative AI, propose new approaches, and contribute to the academic and technical community through publications and presentations.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate generative models into products and services, ensuring they meet business objectives and user needs.
Evaluation and Testing: Develop and implement rigorous testing and evaluation frameworks to assess model performance, robustness, and reliability. Collaborate with the Data team in order to improve our internal ML Ops platform.
Deployment: Collaborate with engineering teams to deploy models in scalable and efficient production environments.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of models, algorithms, experiments, and processes to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work-life balance.


WHO YOU ARE


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or a related field;
Proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar;
Knowledge of generative models, including GANs, VAEs, autoregressive models, and transformers;
Strong problem-solving abilities, with a focus on experimental design and data analysis;
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (both in English and Portuguese), with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


The following are preferred qualifications:


Proficient in model fine-tuning and hyperparameter optimization;
Proven track record of developing and deploying generative AI models in production;
Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) and/or computer vision applications;
Familiarity with vector databases for handling high-dimensional data.


We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience in Data Science and Python are mandatory requirements.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our benefits include:

WELLHUB: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to take care of their wellbeing too. Access digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. You will receive the Gold plan at no cost, and other premium plans will be significantly discounted.

FITNESS: Additional fitness subsidy to access onsite gyms and fitness studios.

FLEXIBLE WORK: At Wellhub, flexibility fosters a happier, healthier, and more productive work environment for everyone. As a Flexible First company, we offer two work model options: flexible hybrid and full remote, and make the office a place for collaboration, community, and team building. The model for this role can be discussed with your recruiter and hiring manager. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to help cover the costs of working from home.

FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We understand that together, Wellhubbers and their leaders can make the best decisions for their own individual scopes. This includes flexibility to adjust their working hours based on their personal schedule, time zone, and business needs.

PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is to take time away from work to recharge. Employees receive a minimum of 25 days paid holiday per year with an additional day for each year of tenure (up to 5) in addition to annual holidays (including an extra holiday on your birthday!).

PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family. We offer 100% paid parental leave to all new parents and extended maternity leave.

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.

CULTURE: An exciting and supportive environment filled with passionate individuals from all over the world! You'll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day. Find more info on our careers page!

And to get a glimpse of Life at Wellhub… Follow us on Instagram @lifeatwellhub and LinkedIn!

Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Wellhub

We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong.

Wellhub is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Apply now for a career that puts wellbeing first!

GET TO KNOW US

Wellhub (formerly Gympass*) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company.

  • Big news: Gympass is now Wellhub! We are thrilled to announce our rebranding as Wellhub, marking a significant milestone in our journey. This transformation reflects our evolution from a "pass for gyms" to a comprehensive employee wellbeing solution. With our refreshed identity, we are poised to embark on an exciting new chapter of growth and expansion. We are elevating our offerings, including a completely new app experience and an expanded network of wellbeing partners. Learn more about it here.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Title: Fullstack Python Developer
Description:
Seeking a Fullstack Python Developer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?


Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.


Perks Of Becoming a Rhino


You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
Opportunities for career progression 📈
Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
Other protocols and special discounts ✨


For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:


Senior Developer with over 5 years of experience in software development, writing and reviewing complex code, establishing and enforcing coding standards, and working closely with product managers, designers, and other developers to ensure the accurate implementation of project requirements;
Experience working with Python and FastAPI for backend development, Typescript and React for frontend development, and managing infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform using Terraform and Kubernetes;
Experience in the healthcare and life sciences domain is highly desirable. Familiarity with healthcare standards such as DICOM, HL7, FHIR, and knowledge of medical ontologies like ICD-10 and SNOMED will be a significant advantage;
Fluency in English (C1 Level) is mandatory;
Full remote work, with occasional travel to Germany required.


Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Data Driven | Data Scientist Tech Lead
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist Tech Lead to join our Data-Driven Intelligence:


Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree and/or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or similar;
  • 5+ years of professional experience in developing and implementing ML models;
  • Experience with Machine Learning/DL/Gen-AI libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, Keras, OpenAI);
  • Expertise in MLOps (ideally in both on-prem and cloud contexts);
  • Specific know-how with the Microsoft Stack (e.g., Azure) is a plus;
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL;
  • Interest in co-designing AI solutions with clients, ability to oversee multiple projects simultaneously;
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, with a desire to be a key piece of a new AI/ML team.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Maintenance and development.
Defining test plan, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Conducting all analyses and pinpoint opportunities for improvement.
Integration into the Client Network and Client HR.
Integration into Client Active is also on the roadmap.

Jira

More Than 7 Years Of Experience

Team spirit and flexibility to work together with consultants in a different timeline.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action.

The analytical team uses state of the art data analytical and visualization techniques to solve business issues and uncover opportunities for BNP Paribas Person Finance. We design and develop our own ML engines, and we make them available to all PF geographies. We have vast amounts of data in the Bank, and we know that the value will come with robust and secure solutions deployed in production.

About The Job

MISSION

As a Data Scientist You Will Use Data And ML Models To Improve Our Interactions With Our Customers. As Part Of This, You Will


Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis.
Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) to build or run existing models.
Use Statistical methodologies (such as clustering) to give better insights of our customer database.
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Ensure high quality of delivery


TEAM

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model.

You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges.

The team is recent, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris.

We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities.

Requirements


A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field
Strong programming skills in Python
Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
Fluency in oral and written English
Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
Availability for occasional travel in Europe
Experience


Some experience in Data Science projects is appreciated


Languages


English - Fluent

Our commitments

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices.

To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization.

What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year;
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)";
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available;
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand.

About The Job

MISSION

As a Data Scientist You Will Use Data And ML Models To Improve Our Interactions With Our Customers. As Part Of This, You Will

  • Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis.
  • Run python-based analytical engines (direct marketing, inbound marketing, web navigation) to build or run existing models.
  • Use Statistical methodologies (such as clustering) to give better insights of our customer database.
  • Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
  • Ensure high quality of delivery

TEAM

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team based in Lisbon and Porto. Our working language is English, and we offer a hybrid work model.

You will report hierarchically to the Team Leader. The marketing side of the Hub has three mid-sized teams (Data Scientists, Data Analysts and Python developers), working together on complex challenges.

The team is recent, agile, and everyone is growing together. More than 20 colleagues are working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences, and you will be able to share your insights with the central teams in Paris.

We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities.

Requirements

  • A degree in Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field
  • Strong programming skills in Python
  • Practical knowledge in data analysis, applied mathematics, and statistics
  • Fluency in oral and written English
  • Knowledge of relational databases such as vertica, oracle, sqlserver
  • Good skills on collaboration, communication, adaptability, assertiveness and initiative spirit
  • Interest in continuous learning and new challenges (machine learning, dev)
  • Availability for occasional travel in Europe
  • Experience

Some experience in Data Science projects is appreciated

  • Languages

English - Fluent

Our commitments

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices.

To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization.

What makes us proud as reference employer?

  • Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year;
  • 92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)";
  • 93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available;
  • 71% of our customers are promoters of our brand.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Lisbon)
Description:
Hi there!

We are Capgemini Engineering. A brand part of the Capgemini Group.

We have the mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, diversity, inclusion, a purpose of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can learn more about Capgemini Engineering here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MZ0Z6PjdnQo.

You can help us to achieve our mission!

Now, we are part of Capgemini Group and we have more than 300,000 team members in nearly 50 countries, and we work with sectors such as aeronautics, automotive, communications, energy, life sciences, software & internet, space & defense and consumer products.

Your Mission

Capgemini Engineering is constantly growing and attentive to market opportunities and in search of the best professionals to join its team. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team, on a hybrid format, with the possibility of participating in many interesting and cutting-edge projects through the whole life-cycle.

Your Role

A Senior Data Scientist exhibits expert-level understanding and execution of data science projects with a strategic impact on the organization. Responsibilities include:


Leadership and mentorship to teams of data scientists and analysts, guiding them to success on intricate data science initiatives.
Defining the strategic direction for data science projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Conducting advanced analysis of complex datasets to derive profound insights, forecast trends, and pinpoint opportunities for improvement.
Designing, implementing, and evaluating advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to address high-impact business challenges.
Lead the integration of big data technologies and advanced analytics solutions into business processes, driving innovation in methodologies and practices.
Establishing best practices for data management, quality, and governance to ensure the integrity and reliability of data science outputs.
Effectively communicating complex analytical concepts and the value of data science initiatives to stakeholders at all levels, including executive leadership.
Advocating for a culture of data-driven decision-making and continuous learning within the organization.


Your Profile


7 or more years of experience in data science and analytics, with a proven track record of leading successful data science projects.
Proficiency of programming languages, including Python and SQL, along with advanced libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow or Pytorch.
Possess a deep understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, predictive modeling, and advanced algorithmic problem-solving.
Showcase extensive experience in data visualization and interpretation, translating complex results into actionable insights.
Exhibit leadership experience with the ability to inspire, guide, and mentor team members to achieve exceptional results.
Possess technical domain knowledge in cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) or big data technologies (Spark).
Have exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with fluency in English and the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.


What we Offer

Our Famous Atmosphere


There’s always someone happy to start the day with a cup of coffee with you – even virtually!
We are a big company with a unique atmosphere – we make friendships, share important moments, and… simply like each other!


A Lot Of Benefits


Referral bonuses for recommending your friends to Capgemini Engineering.
Continuous training on Next*
Offices in a great location
Participation in international projects
Integration in a multinational company
Career Evolution


Location:


Lisbon full-time and hybrid


We inform you that our recruitment process is 100% remote

Apply Now!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
CONTEXT

Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with strengths in jewellery, fine watches & premium accessories, including Cartier, Van Cleef & Arpels, Montblanc, Roger Dubuis, Vacheron Constantin, etc.

Richemont has a strong ambition to transform its business model towards New Retail. Part of this transformation is the Group Data Office that, among others, delivers Analytics & Data Science projects for the different Maisons.

The Analytics & Data Science team, belonging to “Group Data Office”, supports this vision by developing analytics and data science use cases, defining best practices across the group, and industrializing analytics & data science solutions. This team is recruiting a Senior Data Scientist to work under the Lead Data Scientist.

Responsibilities


Design & develop complex ML-driven approaches to resolve business problems .
Gather requirements and effectively communicate developed solution to the Business.
Partner with Machine Learning Engineers, Analytics Engineers & IT to deliver solutions.


Academic Background


Graduate in Master program in Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related fields.


Skills & Experience


Proficient in Python programming language & data-related libraries (6 years +)
Extensive experience in Data Science & Machine Learning (6 years +) in a large variety of topics
Good knowledge in Statistics & SQL
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform or other cloud platform (2 years +)
Experience in Vertex AI is a plus
Experience in Git + Agile Development is a plus.


Desired Personal Skills


Autonomous, proactive & curious with a strong sense of ownership
Proficiency in English is a must: Strong communication skills, ability to explain complex topics to top-level management.
Quick-learner, able to comprehend & resolve complex problems.
Pragmatic mindset to problem solving, and an ability to think critically and objectively.
Ease to collaborate in multicultural and multifunctional environments.

Title: Data Science Director | Generative AI
Description:
Your wellbeing matters. Join a company that cares.

GET TO KNOW US

Wellhub (formerly Gympass*) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company.


Big news: Gympass is now Wellhub! We are thrilled to announce our rebranding as Wellhub, marking a significant milestone in our journey. This transformation reflects our evolution from a "pass for gyms" to a comprehensive employee wellbeing solution. With our refreshed identity, we are poised to embark on an exciting new chapter of growth and expansion. We are elevating our offerings, including a completely new app experience and an expanded network of wellbeing partners. Learn more about it here.


THE OPPORTUNITY

We are hiring a Director Data Scientist for our GenAI team in Brazil!

Our GenAI team leverages advanced AI technologies to personalize user experiences, streamline operations, and optimize resources, acting as a hub for innovation while enabling Wellhub to harness the full potential of generative AI across multiple domains.

We are looking for a talented and motivated Director Data Scientist to join us and contribute to groundbreaking projects in the field of Generative AI.

YOUR IMPACT

As the Data Science Director specializing in Generative AI, you will spearhead the strategy, development, and deployment of AI models that can generate content, solutions, and insights across various domains. You will lead a multidisciplinary team of data scientists and domain experts, guiding them to create innovative AI applications that solve real-world problems and push the boundaries of what AI can achieve.


Strategic Leadership: Define the vision and strategic roadmap for the GenAI data science team, aligning projects with business objectives and ensuring the delivery of high-impact AI solutions.
Model Development Oversight: Lead the design, implementation, and optimization of generative models using advanced machine learning and deep learning techniques, including GANs, VAEs, autoregressive models, and transformers. Provide technical guidance to the team to ensure best practices in model development.
Innovation and Research: Drive research initiatives to stay at the forefront of generative AI, fostering a culture of innovation. Evaluate and integrate the latest advancements in the field to maintain a competitive edge.
Collaboration and Stakeholder Management: Partner with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, and operations, to integrate generative models into products and services. Ensure that AI solutions meet business goals and user needs.
Team Development and Mentorship: Build and mentor a high-performing data science team. Provide career development opportunities, technical training, and foster a collaborative environment.
Model Fine-Tuning and Optimization: Oversee the fine-tuning of pre-trained models to adapt to specific use cases and requirements, ensuring optimal performance. Guide the team in data annotation, preprocessing, and customization of models for various applications.
Prompt Engineering and Evaluation: Guide the development and refinement of prompts to enhance the performance and output quality of generative models. Establish and oversee rigorous testing and evaluation frameworks to assess model performance, robustness, and reliability.
Deployment and Scalability: Collaborate with engineering leaders to ensure the scalable and efficient deployment of models in production environments. Drive the adoption of best practices in ML Ops and model lifecycle management.
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Ensure comprehensive documentation of models, algorithms, experiments, and processes to support reproducibility and foster a culture of knowledge sharing within the team and organization.
Leadership:
Lead a team of highly autonomous, proactive and motivated data scientists.
Periodically monitor and own your team's health, while promoting a highly psychologically safe environment which welcomes ideas and different points of view.
Drive critical projects from the architectural design to implementation.
Plan and successfully deliver cross team projects.
Provide estimates on efforts and risks, evaluating technical feasibility on cross-functional high-impact projects.
Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own wellbeing and your colleagues. Bring wellbeing to the forefront of work, and create a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable taking care of themselves, taking time off, and finding work-life balance.

WHO YOU ARE


Advanced Degree: Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or a related field.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience in Python and machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar. Deep knowledge of generative models, including GANs, VAEs, autoregressive models, and transformers.
Leadership Experience: Proven experience leading data science teams, with a track record of delivering high-impact AI solutions in production environments.
Strategic Thinking: Strong problem-solving abilities, with a focus on strategic planning, experimental design, and data analysis. Ability to align technical efforts with business objectives.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and executive leadership.
The following are preferred qualifications:
Expertise in model fine-tuning, hyperparameter optimization, and deployment.
Proven track record of developing and deploying generative AI models in production environments.
Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) and/or computer vision applications.
Experience with vector databases for handling high-dimensional data.

We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. We welcome your application and will be delighted to explore if you could be a great fit for our team. For this specific role, please note that prior experience leading data science teams working in AI solutions and extensive experience in Python and machine learning frameworks are mandatory requirements.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our benefits include:

WELLHUB: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to take care of their wellbeing too. Access digital fitness programs, and online wellness resources for meditation, nutrition, mental health support, and more. You will receive the Gold plan at no cost, and other premium plans will be significantly discounted.

FITNESS: Additional fitness subsidy to access onsite gyms and fitness studios.

FLEXIBLE WORK: Choose when and where you work. For most, this will be a hybrid office/remote structure, but can vary depending on the needs of the role and employee preferences. We offer all employees a home office stipend and a monthly flexible work allowance to cover the costs of working from home.


Our offices are in Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Portugal, Romania, Spain, and the UK. You can work from any office or remotely based in any of these countries.


FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: We understand that together, Wellhubbers and their leaders can make the best decisions for their own individual scopes. This includes flexibility to adjust their working hours based on their personal schedule, time zone, and business needs.

PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is to take time away from work to recharge. Employees receive a minimum of 25 days paid holiday per year with an additional day for each year of tenure (up to 5) in addition to annual holidays (including an extra holiday on your birthday!).

PARENTAL LEAVE: Welcoming a new child is one of the most special moments in your life and we want our employees to take the time to be present and enjoy their growing family. We offer 100% paid parental leave to all new parents and extended maternity leave.

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth. That means we maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development.

CULTURE: An exciting and supportive environment filled with passionate individuals from all over the world! You'll partner with global colleagues and share in the success of a high-growth technology company disrupting the health and wellness space. Our value-based culture of trust, flexibility, and integrity makes this possible every day. Find more info on our careers page!

And to get a glimpse of Life at Wellhub… Follow us on Instagram @wellhublife and LinkedIn!

Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Wellhub

We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong.

Wellhub is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
HTML:
Chegou o momento de te desafiares a sair da tua zona de conforto fazendo parte de um grande projeto? Vem trabalhar connosco e potenciar ainda mais o teu desenvolvimento!

Integra uma nova equipa da Deloitte Portugal – AI Insights – onde trabalharás na interseção do negócio com analytics com os melhores especialistas em Data Science . Enquanto  Lead Data Scientist , terás a oportunidade de participar em projetos de advanced analytics que transformam as operações e o negócio dos nossos Clientes Financial Services, à escala global, criando e entregando soluções inovadoras de Portugal para o mundo. Procuramos perfis que combinem skills , analíticas de excelência, capacidade de entender o negócio e os processos, com o mindset de problem solving e orientação para a excelência do nosso serviço.

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho e, por isso, oferecemos um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira com formação ajustada ao teu perfil e aos teus objetivos profissionais. Terás uma experiência profissional que te irá inspirar, ao lado de outros talentos como tu, a transformar o mundo como o conhecemos: a torná-lo mais humano, eficiente e tecnológico.

Estão reunidos todos os ingredientes para poderes embarcar nesta viagem enriquecedora e desafiante que é o mundo Deloitte?

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades vão ser compostos por:

  • Foco no desenvolvimento e entrega de soluções de IA garantindo o sucesso no projeto e a excelência da entrega;
  • Liderar uma equipa de Data Scientists que trabalham diariamente para resolver desafios complexos do mundo real desenvolvendo soluções de advanced analytics que criam um impacto relevante no Cliente;
  • Participar em projetos de cliente desde a fase de framing do problema analítico, passando pela recolha e análise dos dados, pelo enrichment do dataset, pelo desenvolvimento e treino de modelos até ao deploy da solução;
  • Participar nas iniciativas de R&D onde há uma constante procura por inovação tecnológica da prática de data science e espaço de experimentação e cocriação multidisciplinar;
  • Análise de grandes quantidades de dados de diferentes fontes de dados;
  • Comunicação com profundidade técnica dos desenvolvimentos realizados.


És tu quem procuramos:

  • Mestrado ou PhD com relevante desempenho académico nas áreas de Estatística / Matemática Aplicada, Física, Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar;
  • Experiência relevante de pelo menos 5 anos em consultoria de Data science envolvendo framing do problema, análise de dados, treino e deploy de modelos de machine Learning e sua monitorização;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em analytics: machine learning, análise estatística, otimização e simulação;
  • Conhecimento e experiência em linguagens de programação com foco em machine learning e advanced analytics (tais como Python, R e Scala);
  • Conhecimento em SQL;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em tecnologia Cloud (preferencial);
  • Experiência com casos de uso reais utilizando OCR, Computer Vision e Natural Language Processing para processamento de imagens (preferencial);
  • Excelentes capacidades de comunicação oral e escrita, em português e inglês, para públicos técnicos e de negócio;
  • Espírito curioso, com gosto por aprendizagem contínua e com paixão por resolver problemas complexos;
  • Gosto por comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração;
  • Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos entregáveis


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy)
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e percursores de tendências
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte, nunca trabalharás sozinho. Vais integrar os mais variados e desafiantes projetos e fazer parte do nosso Global Solutions Center, onde poderás colaborar de forma integrada com outras equipas da rede global Deloitte. Terás sempre alguém ao teu lado para te inspirar, ajudar e desafiar a expandir os teus horizontes, enquanto exploras soluções tecnológicas diferenciadoras. Aqui, ao encontrares um ambiente dinâmico, colaborativo e humano, terás a oportunidade de desenvolver a tua melhor versão.

Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em diversas expertises tecnológicas.

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências e fazer parte de equipas que desenvolvem soluções nas tecnologias líderes de mercado, então estás no lugar certo!

Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga, Setúbal e Leiria.

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Consulting; Technology

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Ad Intelligence
Description:
Fraud warning:

It's common for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites. To ensure your submission is considered, only apply for positions at Sensor Tower through our company website or through posts directly associated with Sensor Tower company profiles on sites such as LinkedIn, Indeed, BuiltIn or Hackajob. At no point will Sensor Tower ever ask for money, credit card, or bank account information to complete a job application. Communications received from Sensor Tower are only sent by e-mail addresses ending in sensortower.com . All Sensor Tower interviews will be conducted via phone or Zoom. At no time will a conversation be moved to an alternative email outside of sensortower.com or text. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume when applying.

To all recruitment agencies:

Sensor Tower does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Sensor Tower employees or any other organization location. Sensor Tower is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Sensor Tower will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Sensor Tower.

About this role:

Do you want to work for a company with a successful track record of profitability?

Are you looking to solve innovative data collection and processing problems at scale?

Are you interested in working on high-visibility, rapid-release products?

Do you value working with talented, experienced, friendly colleagues?

Join us in our journey to change how the world gains insights in digital marketing!

The Senior Data Scientist at Sensor Tower will leverage digital advertising along with mobile, desktop, and OTT industry knowledge to drive strategies that improve the accuracy and offerings for our Digital Marketing insights solution. This solution draws upon large-scale data (over 140 billion data records) and allows our customers to uncover insights like which apps or brands are advertising the most by channel and platform, which creatives are performing the best across certain ad networks, which ad network an advertiser is marketing on the most, and how much advertisers are spending in a channel and country.

What You Will Work On


Execute on the development of data modeling algorithms with a focus on: analyzing large sets of data, building models, ensuring data accuracy, reliability and consistency.
Develop, refine and bring data models to production. This role will work on models that are consumed by our end users, building internal tools and one time reports as well as working on the actual product that our users consume and rely on every day.
Consult on the use of AI to improve workflows for data extraction and classification.
Embrace a quick build, measure and iterate cycle to bring products to market and work alongside world class engineers, and data scientists.
Act as subject matter expert for our digital advertising.


What We Are Looking For


Degree in Mathematics/ Statistics/ Computer Science or a related engineering/ technical or quantitative field.


Min 4 years of experience as a Data Scientist in the ad-tech / mar-tech or data analytics companies, including the following experience in:


business intelligence, data mining, analytics, and statistical modeling disciplines;
analyzing and presenting data insights and code, communicating effectively with technical developers and non-technical marketing business partners, teammates and leadership;
implementing machine learning algorithms, working end-to-end on machine learning pipelines in production;
data engineering working on ETL pipelines, crawling APIs and websites, and automating outputs (report generation, workflow automation, Google Sheet interaction);
setting and meeting detailed timelines and expectations while executing projects, developing projects in a resilient way that anticipates future changes and interaction with other parts of the product;
data research, identifying the necessary edge cases that need to be tested in order to fully understand the data;
programming in Python or Ruby, utilizing AWS S3, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, AWS Redshift or similar database technologies;
using Jupyter notebooks and one or more statistical visualization or graphing toolkits such as Excel, Qlik Sense or Tableau.


Technical Blog Posts

Read more about what our Engineers and Data Scientists do: https://sensortower.com/blog?category=2037363497

Products

We offer unique insights into the digital marketplace for mobile apps and app stores, consumer app usage, digital advertising, and brands with our recent acquisition of Pathmatics.

Customers

We serve small, independent and Fortune 1000 customers alike, spanning the mobile games, travel & hospitality, music, finance, CPG, and broadcast entertainment markets. We offer our suite of products on free, small-medium-size business, and enterprise tiers to make it accessible to the broadest range of customers.

Media

We are cited by the world’s leading news and finance media: The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg, CNBC, The Washington Post, and Reuters.

About Sensor Tower

Sensor Tower cultivates responsibly sourced market intelligence that provides visibility into the trends shaping the global digital economy. Our customers use these insights to help them make better business decisions.

Why Sensor Tower?

Our flexible work environment allows employees to live in greater connection with the people, places, and activities they love!

Our benefits for full-time positions include:


Flexible time off so employees can shape their time away from work.
Health and wellness stipend to achieve and maintain a healthy lifestyle through physical and mental fitness.
Monthly internet stipend and a one-time $500 home office stipend.


We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, and veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. If you have a disability or special need, please do not hesitate to let us know and we'll do our best to accommodate.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Scoring Center (M/F - Hybrid)
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets, we are leaders and we invest in innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast-growing business

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

Senior Data Scientist – Scoring Center (M/F)

#Data#Investigation#Standartization

In practice, your day-to-day

As a Senior Data Scientist in the Scoring Center team, you will undertake projects to build risk prediction models. Your main responsibilities will be:


As part of your modelling projects, you assess the needs expressed, define and propose the adapted deliverables and estimate their burden and time frame through an implementation plan that takes into account the challenges and constraints. You use statistical modelling methods (such as Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting…), analyze and explain the results;
You lead the project, keep track of the schedule and support the implementation and monitoring of the tools issued;
As part of the monitoring and optimization of the BNP Paribas Personal Finance score models, you participate in the monitoring campaigns of the scores: generation and analysis of monitoring results, diagnosis and action plan;
You are also responsible for conducting or analyzing statistical studies related to risk prediction models. If necessary, you take part in analytical support missions to the Group's international entities and in the processing of audit recommendations relating to the Basel regulatory project;
In addition, you actively contribute to the transversal missions of the Scoring Center: technological and methodological watch, regulatory watch, training, analytical support for the Group's international entities.



The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!

Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team. Our working language is English.

You will be in the Scoring Center teams that are made up of 30 Data Scientists that will work with you. The team in Lisbon is new and everyone is growing together. You'll be surrounded by colleagues working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences.

We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on the job training, online learning and networking opportunities.

What do we have to offer you?

This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.

Are you the one we are looking for?

Do you have a Degree in Mathematics or Statistics?

Do you have a strong scientific background and 5 years of experience in a statistical/risk environment (preferably in a banking environment)?

Do you have good skills in Python?

Are you proficient in modelling environment or data lab and have a strong knowledge of the main data science libraries?

Do you have experience in machine models industrialization?

Are you able to work on several projects in parallel and are acknowledge for your accuracy?

Are you fluent in oral and written English?

If you recognize yourself in this description, and have a lot of enthusiasm, energy and motivation, then you are the one we are looking for!

We look forward to your application!

Our commitments

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices.

To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization.

What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the sixth consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)".
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available.
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand



Primary Location

PT-11-Lisbon

Job Type

Standard / Permanent

Job

MISCELLANEOUS

Education Level

Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)

Experience Level

At least 5 years

Schedule

Full-time

Title: Junior Developer | Sintra
HTML:
Position Description

Já concluíste o teu curso ou vais terminá-lo em breve? Gostarias de fazer parte de uma das maiores empresas de IT do mundo?

Se te consideras dinâmico(a), inovador(a), dedicado(a) e com vontade de aprender, temos as oportunidades certas para ti!

Integrarás projetos de desenvolvimento e implementação de soluções e farás parte de equipas focadas na entrega de projetos para clientes.

Your future duties and responsibilities

  • Análise de problemas e documentação de especificações;
  • Implementação de soluções propostas com a restante equipa;
  • Elaboração de testes;
  • Programação de sistemas;
  • Participação em reuniões diárias.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

  • Licenciatura e/ou Mestrado nas áreas de Eng. Informática, Eng. Eletrotécnica e de Computadores;
  • Gosto pela área da programação;
  • Capacidade de adaptação a diferentes contextos de trabalho;
  • Gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Vontade de aprender;
  • Conhecimentos de inglês.

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER

CONTEXT

Richemont has a strong ambition to transform its business model towards New Retail. Part of this transformation is the Group Data Office that, among others, delivers Analytics & Data Science projects for the different Maisons.

The Analytics & Data Science team, belonging to “Group Data Office”, supports this vision by developing analytics and data science use cases, defining best practices across the group, and industrializing analytics & data science solutions. This team is recruiting a Senior ML Engineer to work under the Lead Machine Learning Engineer.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?


Develop components of the analytics and machine learning platform, including: infrastructure modules, reusable components for AI/Analytics applications or architecture templates
Industrialize, maintain and improve AI and analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform
Manage the infrastructure with special focus on reliance, security and scalability
Partner with Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists, Infrastructure & Data Engineers for the project delivery


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCESS WITH US?


Graduate in Master program in Engineering, Data Science, or related fields or equivalent professional experience
Proficient in Python programming & SQL (5 years or more)
Practical experience in MLOPs (3-5 years or more)
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform (2 years +)
Practical experience with infrastructure as a code, ideally Terraform (1 years+)
Knowledge of Data Engineering principles
Knowledge of REST API and microservices
A dynamic, innovative & pragmatic mindset to problem solving, and an ability to think critically and objectively, both independently & within a team
Proactive, curious and autonomous with a strong sense of ownership and always on the look to improve the current solutions
Strong communication skills, English is a must, ease to collaborate in multicultural and multifunctional environments
Experience in Vertex AI and DBT is a plus


HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a fantastic opportunity to join the leader of luxury digital distribution as a builder of excellence for such a transformational practice. The business impact up for grasps, the AI use cases and diversity of stakeholders will make it rich, fast-paced, multicultural and fun for the right candidate.

Your Journey With Us

 1.    If your application is selected, we will reach out to you ASAP for an informal introductory call.


    The next step from there would be interviews with the Head of Data Science, Lead Machine Learning Engineer and our HR Business Partner.


 

LEARN MORE ABOUT LIFE AT RICHEMONT AND OUR MAISONS BELOW

 https://www.linkedin.com/company/richemont/ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtcz344eqsWvggwOnq-yljg

#RICHEMONT #REVEALTHEEXCEPTIONNAL

Title: React Developer
Description:
Seeking a React Developer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?


Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.


Perks Of Becoming a Rhino


You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
Opportunities for career progression 📈
Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
Other protocols and special discounts ✨


For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:


Over 4 years of professional experience.
Extensive experience with React, Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and CI/CD.
Skilled in optimizing build processes with Webpack
Accessibility (a11y) standards knowledge
Fluent in English (B2 Level).
Available to work in a hybrid setup in Lisbon, Coimbra, or Braga.


Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of €1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let’s fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description
  • Making sure that customer requirements are understandable to the project team and programmers;
  • Drawing up and implementing test acceptance criteria;
  • Ensuring the evolution of applications and the design of new applications, through needs assessment.


Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in the IT area or equivalent;
  • Over 6 years' experience in the field;
  • Experience in project management methodologies such as Agile, Scrum, Design Thinking;
  •  Excellent analysis and communication skills;
  • Knowledge of Jira and/or Confluence tools will be valued;
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken).


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. Title: React Developer (W/M) - Lisbon
HTML:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

Your Role

We are looking for motivated React developers to reinforce our development teams in Lisbon to contribute to impactful projects within the streaming plataform.

We value exceptional customer service and seek individuals who are naturally curious, thrive on challenging the status quo, and are committed to leaving things better than they found them. If this sounds like you, you'd be a valuable asset in this role. We welcome candidates at various levels of experience to apply.

Your Profile

Mandatory skills:

  • Proven experience as a Front End Engineer;
  • Proficient on the basic Front End development technologies: HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript/TyperScript
  • Good knowledge of React
  • Experience in Unit Test (writing and configuration)
  • Experience with Jira and Confluence;
  • Experience in agile methodologies (Agile, Scrum or other);
  • Experience in CI/CD Microservices, Kubernetes, Cloud.
  • Proficiency in Portuguese;
  • Good knowledge in English.

It’s a Plus

  • Knowledge in backend Java;

What You'll Love About Working Here

  • Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment;
  • Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance;
  • Engage in exciting national and international projects;
  • Hybrid work;
  • Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities;
  • Training and certifications programs;
  • Health and life insurance;
  • Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations;
  • Great office locations.

About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Devops Enginner
HTML:
Nice to meet you, we are Grupo Data!

Our purpose is to simplify our customers' lives and we do this all over the world, through our IT solutions.

We are a multinational company that actively operates in Brazil and Portugal and we're growing by the day!

We love working with big companies and also make them bigger! We're committed to being the change we want to see in large corporations in the market and we start by valuing people and their ideas.

We have already realized that there is not just one way to make things work out. Each and everyone of our employees has unique skills and, to work as a team, we need to truly know each other.

We are a Great Place to Work company - We're certificated as one of the Best Companies to Work For and we are very proud to have made it this far!

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Designing and architecting solutions for existing client facing applications as they are moved into cloud

environments, such as, AWS;

  • Designing and building tools as well as frameworks that support deploying and managing our platforms;
  • Suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements;
  • Supporting and troubleshooting scalability, high availability, performance, monitoring, back-up and

restores of different environments;

  • Ensuring critical system security through the use of best in class cloud security solutions;
  • System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains;
  • Create, maintain and optimize automated build and deployment pipelines;
  • Work with Cloud Infrastructure team on Cloud migration of applications.

What we need

  • Several years of experience as DevOps Engineer;
  • Strong development background in Java;
  • Strong experience with AWS;
  • Experience with Kubernetes and Terraform;
  • Ansible know-how;
  • Good English skills, both spoken and written;
  • Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and impact on companys success;
  • Team Player;
  • Available for travelling abroad

Title: Software Developer (F/M)
HTML:
Ayming est un Groupe international de conseil présent dans 14 pays. Nous sommes leader du conseil en amélioration de la performance des entreprises dans le domaine des ressources humaines, de l’innovation et de la fiscalité. Notre conviction est de soutenir une innovation et un engagement durable. Nous accompagnons nos clients au travers de 3 solutions : consulting, services managés et digital.

Votre job Quelles sont les missions qui vous seront confiées quand vous intégrerez les équipes d’Ayming?

  • Sous la reponsabilité du Tech Lead local, vous contribuez au développement de plusieurs applications pour nos coeurs de métier, avec une partie exposée à nos clients;
  • Participer au développement et à la maintenance de solutions web en architecture micro-service pour un environnement AWS modernisé;
  • Participer au développement et à la maintenance de solutions web en architecture micro-service pour un environnement AWS modernisé;
  • Coder des tests de type BDD pour assurer la qualité et la robustesse des applications;
  • Coder des tests de type BDD pour assurer la qualité et la robustesse des applications;
  • Gérer et maintenir les pipelines DevOps pour le CI/CD;
  • Participer aux cérémonies Agile (stand-ups, sprint planning, rétrospectives);
  • Fournir un support technique et résoudre les problèmes techniques complexes.


Dans quels environnements vous interviendrez?

Web Developer – Software – DSI – IT

Vos talents et aspirations professionnelles Vous avez:

  • Au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans le développement de logiciels;
  • Maîtrise des langages de programmation tels que C#, Python, JavaScript;
  • Expérience avec des frameworks et des bibliothèques modernes (React, Angular, .NET);
  • Bonne compréhension des principes de conception orientée objet et des architectures logicielles;
  • Expérience des méthodologies Agile;
  • Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et de débogage;
  • Connaissance des outils de contrôle de version tels que Git.


Vous êtes:

  • Passionné par le développement de logiciels et nouvelles technologies;
  • Sens de la qualité, le souci du détail et la capacité à prendre des initiatives;
  • Adaptable, simultanément plusieurs tâches tout en restant motivé par l’apprentissage continu et le développement professionnel.


Si vous devenez un Aymer? Vous bénéficierez:

Bien-être au travail et carrière

  • Rejoindre un groupe à dimension internationale;
  • Système hybride: télétravail 60% et présentiel 40%;
  • Horaire flexible entre 7h et 18h du lundi au vendredi;
  • Possibilité d’évolution au sein de l’entreprise.


Package de rémunération et avantages sociaux

  • Contrat permanent (CDI);
  • Rémunération fixe et variable sur 14 mois;
  • Carte repas 9,15 €;
  • Remboursement du titre de transport;
  • Assurance santé privée.


Vous pensez que vous n’avez pas le profil ? Et pourtant chez Ayming, c’est votre personnalité, vos talents et vos passions qui font la différence.

Aplicar Send to a friend ›

Partilhe este artigo

Aplicar Send to a friend ›

  • Nome *
  • Apelido *

  • E-mail *
  • Upload do seu CV * Tipos de ficheiro aceites: pdf, doc, rtf, txt, Tamanho máx. de ficheiro: 24 MB.

    • Autorizo que a Ayming utilize estes dados para me contactar em resposta a esta candidatura


Todos os seus dados estão protegidos e seguros, de acordo com o que consta na nossa política de privacidade. Subscrever informação adicional não é mandatório para receber estes conteúdos.

Title: Front-End Developer (m/f)
HTML:
We are looking for a Frontend Developer to join the internal team of our client – a reference Portuguese company in the banking sector.

What will be your main tasks and responsibilities?


  • Participate in all phases of the software development cycle;
  • Define the Client-side architecture, ensuring the best practices in software design and development;
  • Understand the internal clients’ business requirements and implement it at a technical level trying to meet the business expectations;
  • Working in close collaboration with the other teams and business areas.


What is required from you?


  • Academic background in Computer Engineering, Information Systems Management or other similar area;
  • At least 3 years of experience in software development;
  • Knowledge of React and React Native;
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills;
  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken).


Sounds like you? Send us your CV and let’s talk!

Os candidatos interessados, em cumprimento do definido no Regulamento (UE) 2016/679 (RGPD), são convidados a ler a política de privacidade em https://pt.gigroup.com. Parte da Gi Group Holding, a Gi Group reconhece e respeita a diversidade das pessoas e acredita que proporcionar igualdade de oportunidades, através de processos justos com base na meritocracia e competência profissional, valorizar a diversidade de semelhanças e diferenças que criam a singularidade de cada pessoa e promover uma cultura de inclusão eliminando fatores que desencorajam ou dificultam o acesso, a permanência e o crescimento no mundo do trabalho é fundamental para o seu sucesso. Title: Senior Engineer (Lisboa / Híbrido)
Description:
Muito Gosto! Somos o Grupo DATA!

O nosso propósito é simplificar a vida dos nossos clientes e fazemos isso em todo o mundo, através das nossas soluções de TI.

Somos uma multinacional que opera activamente em Portugal, e estamos em constante expansão!

Adoramos trabalhar com grandes empresas e fazer crescer as empresas com as quais colaboramos.

Comprometemo-nos a ser a mudança que queremos ver nas grandes corporações do mercado, começando por valorizar as pessoas e as suas ideias.

Já percebemos que não existe apenas uma maneira de fazer as coisas funcionarem, que cada um dos nossos colaboradores tem características únicas e que, para trabalhar em equipa, precisamos realmente de nos conhecer.

Quem procuramos?

Senior Engineer (Lisboa / Híbrido)

Requirements


Develop and implement monitoring, alerting, and incident response strategies.
Automate routine tasks and processes to reduce manual intervention and improve efficiency.
Collaborate with software engineering teams to design and deploy reliable, scalable, and efficient systems.
Deploy production changes with precision ensuring minimal disruption to services and maintaining the integrity of the platform. Rotation based weekend work may be required.
Manage incident including detailed analysis and reporting to maintain high service levels.
Patriciate in on-call rotations to provide support for critical systems and services.


Essential Skills


Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux systems and networking.
Proficiency in programming and scripting languages such as Python, Go, Bash, or similar
Experience with monitoring and observability tools such as ITRS Geneos, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex systems.
English - Expert
Show more

Title: Quantative Developer Internship
Description:
We are looking for:

A Junior Analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest to work with NFTs. You may have already explored NFT trading either personally or professionally and have an interest in working with large data sets. In this role you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

You may be a dynamic analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest in track record in programming; DeFi, and data science are subjects you already have explored. In your role, you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

Job Description

This role will be focusing on the liquidity provision of NFT ecosystems. You will have a heavy emphasis on data analytical modelling and potentially financial strategies. The role will be also be supporting our existing trading teams working in our NFT Business Unit.

Skills Needed


Understanding of how to pull data from the blockchain
Knows how to read and present data or parse it to create models
An interest or experience in financial strategies, e.g. arbitrage (not essential)
Knowledge of SQL
A degree of technical aptitude with programming skills across any software languages for example: Python/C++/C/Rust or Java (not essential)
Any exposure into trading NFT’s would be highly advantageous
Exposure to DeFi ecosystems would be highly advantageous


Interview process:

1st Stage is a short technical interview with the Hiring Manager

2nd stage: Tech Challenge

3rd Stage: Tech Challenge Debrief

4th Stage: Final meeting with the wider team

Offer

Our recruitment philosophy

We believe the most important aspect of our recruitment process is self-awareness: we are looking for people who have a clear understanding of themselves and what they are looking for in their professional career. That means that we expect to work with people who not only have the right skills, but who have also made the conscious decision to look for a company in our industry and with our characteristics and are willing to ask questions and learn in a context that may not be familiar to them.

Our offer


A 6 month paid internship at Belgians leading digital assets company
The standard type of contract used in Belgium for professional internships is a so-called convention d'immersion professionnelle, with a fixed salary of ~1k EUR
The opportunity to learn about digital assets and blockchain from a 30,000 ft view of the entire ecosystem
Working from one of Brussels newest, nicest and most advanced office spaces


We have a strong preference for the internship to take place on-site in Belgium. In rare cases, for candidates based outside of Belgium, an alternative type of contract can be considered.

Keyrock offers you both a career and a large range of benefits that we will gladly discuss in the course of the application process.

As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.
